title: THE EXCHANGE
author: John Grisham
description: In a sequel to “The Firm,” Mitch McDeere, who is now a partner at the world’s largest law firm, gets caught up in a sinister plot.

title: FOURTH WING
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

title: LESSONS IN CHEMISTRY
author: Bonnie Garmus
description: A scientist and single mother living in California in the 1960s becomes a star on a TV cooking show.

title: TOM LAKE
author: Ann Patchett
description: Three daughters, who return to their family orchard in the spring of 2020, learn about their mother’s relationship with a famous actor.

title: COMMONWEALTH
author: Ann Patchett
description: In 1960s California, lawyer Bert Cousins divorces Teresa, leaving her to raise their four children alone Beverly Keating divorces Fix, an L.A. cop; and Bert and Beverly marry and relocate to Virginia

title: HOLLY
author: Stephen King
description: The private detective Holly Gibney investigates whether a married pair of octogenarian academics had anything to do with Bonnie Dahl’s disappearance.

title: JUDGMENT PREY
author: John Sandford
description: The 33rd book in the Prey series. Davenport and Flowers investigate the murder of a federal judge and his two young sons.

title: DEMON COPPERHEAD
author: Barbara Kingsolver
description: Winner of a 2023 Pulitzer Prize for fiction. A reimagining of Charles Dickens’s “David Copperfield” set in the mountains of southern Appalachia.

title: THE MAGICIAN'S ASSISTANT
author: Ann Patchett
description: A secretive magician’s death becomes the catalyst for his partner’s journey of self-discovery in this enchanting book that is something of a magic trick in itself-a 1990s love story with the grace and charm of a nineteenth-century novel

title: THE ARMOR OF LIGHT
author: Ken Follett
description: The fifth book in the Kingsbridge series. Change and turmoil affect various aspects of society in the latter part of the 18th century.

title: OCEAN PREY
author: John Sandford
description: An off-duty Coast Guardsman is fishing with his family when he calls in some suspicious behavior from a nearby boat.

title: STROM FRONT
author: John Sandford
description: In Israel, a man clutching a backpack searches desperately for a boat. It's an Israeli cop, and she's chasing a man who's smuggled out an extraordinary relic

title: JACKDAWS
author: Ken Follett
description: With the Allies preparing for the invasion of Nazi-occupied Europe, Felicity Flick Clariet, an agent in the ranks of the British Special Operations Executive, is given the job of destroying German lines of communications

title: THE COVENANT OF WATER
author: Abraham Verghese
description: Three generations of a family living on South India’s Malabar Coast suffer the loss of a family member by drowning.

title: SWORD CATCHER
author: Cassandra Clare
description: An orphan who is the body double for a royal heir and a woman with magical abilities are drawn into the underworld of the city-state of Castellane.

title: REMARKABLY BRIGHT CREATURES
author: Shel Van Pelt
description: A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there.

title: The Judge's List
author: John Grisham
description: Lacy Stoltz, a Florida Board on Judicial Conduct investigator, sees corruption among the judges. In The Judge's List, she finds a judge who may be taking lives.

title: THE HEAVEN & EARTH GROCERY STORE
author: James McBride
description: Secrets held by the residents of a dilapidated neighborhood come to life when a skeleton is found at the bottom of a well.

title: BLOOD LINES
author: Nelson DeMille and Alex DeMille
description: The second book in the Scott Brodie and Maggie Taylor series. After a mission in Venezuela, Brodie and Taylor search for the murderer of a fellow agent.

title: SECOND ACT
author: Danielle Steel
description: The former head of a Hollywood studio thinks the unfinished novel written by a woman he hired to get his affairs in order could be adapted for the screen.

title: SUNSET IN ST. TROPEZ
author: Danielle Steel
description: The former head of a Hollywood studio thinks the unfinished novel written by a woman he hired to get his affairs in order could be adapted for the screen.

title: THE UNMAKING OF JUNE FARROW
author: Adrienne Young
description: After her grandmother’s death, a woman goes on a journey that might change the past and the future.
